March 2021 #EUChildRights #EUChildGuarantee EU Strategy on the Rights of the child Every child in Europe, and everywhere else, should enjoy the same rights and live free from discrimination and intimidation. With a new Strategy on the Rights of the Child, the Commission is addressing persistent and emerging challenges and proposing concrete actions to protect, promote and fulfil children’s rights in today’s ever-changing world. This Strategy draws on the contributions of over 10,000 children from the EU and beyond. 1 1 The data presented here, unless indicated otherwise, come from the reports: “Our Europe, our rights, our future”, “Just with children. The European Commission will: • seek to address domestic and gender-based violence, and harmful practices against women and girls; • strengthen integrated child protection systems. 1/2 • set up an EU Children’s Participation Platform; • include children as agents of change in the implementation of the Climate Pact and the European Green Deal. • set up a new European Child Guarantee for children in need; • support efforts towards affordable and accessible healthcare, healthy nutrition, psycho-social support, education and leisure activities. • support the training of justice professionals on child-friendly justice; • work with the Council of Europe to implement their 2010 guidelines on child-friendly justice. • step up the fight against online child sexual abuse and make service providers detect and report inappropriate content online; • adopt an updated Better Internet for Kids Strategy in 2022. • maintain a zero tolerance policy on child labour; • allocate 10% of humanitarian aid and funding to education in emergencies and protracted crises. © European Union, 2021 Illustrations: © European Commission Reuse of this document is allowed, provided appropriate credit is given and any changes are indicated (Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license).
